articles.title: Boston College football loses at Michigan State in double overtime
articles.description:
BC came tantalizingly close, behind a spectacular performance from quarterback Dylan Lonergan, but fell, 42-40, in a double-overtime thriller.

The post Boston College football loses at Michigan State in double overtime appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Boston College football lost 42-40 to Michigan State in double overtime on September 7.
Quarterback Dylan Lonergan delivered a standout performance, contributing significantly to the team's effort.
The loss may affect BC's momentum and fan support in the upcoming season.

articles.title: Fear and Loathing in New England
articles.description:
With a free, rare retrospective up now in Maine, Legendary gonzo artist Ralph Steadman talks favorite works, “Breaking Bad” — and the time Hunter S. Thompson took drugs, shot flares and attempted to deface a yacht in Newport.

The post Fear and Loathing in New England appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Ralph Steadman's retrospective is currently free to view in Maine for local art enthusiasts.
Steadman discusses his works and experiences with Hunter S. Thompson during the event.
Boston residents can explore Steadman's influence on art and culture through this unique exhibition.

articles.title: New report outlines how many people might lose SNAP in Greater Boston under Trump bill
articles.description:
About 7% of Boston-area SNAP recipients are at risk of losing their food assistance thanks to Trump’s One Big Beautiful Bill.

The post New report outlines how many people might lose SNAP in Greater Boston under Trump bill appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Approximately 7% of SNAP recipients in Greater Boston may lose benefits under Trump's new bill.
The proposed changes could affect thousands of local families relying on food assistance.
Potential loss of SNAP benefits raises concerns about food security in Boston communities.
